dialogues.text: -- hello? A WOMAN'S VOICE. We can't place why... but it's really cr

dialogues.speaker: JERRY

dialogues.text: Oh. That's right. He stamped visas in Karachi for a year. Then was a junior FSO in Beirut. Interesting places.

dialogues.text: What're you... saying.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN

dialogues.text: what? No, why? Morgan pulls out a SURVEILLANCE PHOTO: Jerry, college-age STUDENT RALLY holding up a sign with an image of the Pent crossed out in red: "DECLARE WAR ON WAR!"

dialogues.text: (stares-at pic; LAUGHS) Wait. Come on -- okay: her name was Julia, she was the smokinist girl I'd ever seen and she wanted me -- I would've gone to an "Anti-Oxygen" rally for her. I swear to God, dude--

dialogues.text: Don't "dude" me. I'm not your friend. I don't have friends... so: Jerry. Why'd you drop out of school?

dialogues.text: Why'd you stay in? I don't know, I didn't really see the point.

dialogues.text: You haven't been able to hold a job

dialogues.text: Construction work, bartender in Singapore, telemarketing, real estate office, messenger, supermarket sign painter, taxi driver, gas station in Florida, fishing boat in Alaska--

You're not spec, airplane manuals, plus listening to me! twelve hundred pounds. of-- sit (tries to stand up) your ass down now -- ammonium (abruptly sits) nitrate fertilizer. Just curious if you knew any of Paul's friends in Beirut, or if he knew any of your friends -- what do you mean in Singapore, oh but that's "friends"?! right, we haven't really established whether or not you two were close-- (losing it) -- I guess we were rett close when I looked into his open casket this morning and saw the bad make-up job covering the gash in his skull! Or how about when I watched him being lowered into the ground -- that establish anything for you?! Somebody set me up! Morgan stares at him, unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: "Somebody." Who?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: A woman, I don't know! She called me and told me I was gonna be arrested. GET

She watches longer than should... then goes back to her work. He gets in the elevator and she's left in her solitude. A we BEGIN TO SEE the first signs of it: loneliness.

dialogues.text: Ican derail his train. I can kill him at any time. I'll ask again: would you risk`. your life for your son? Suddenly the BROWSER GOES BLANK: "UNABLE TO ACCESS PAGE." Kyle's taken from her, that fast -- she gasps, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: yes...

Jerry and Rachel look at each other -- a computer?!

dialogues.text: After 911, our problem wasn't collecting data, it was interpreting it fast enough. Ergo: quantum rocessin (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Today there are more microchips than people, and they can all be data-mined, either via direct connectivity or wireless signals --let's say we're chasing someone with a suitcase nuke in L.A., we can order Aria to shut down mass transit, track the perp through traffic cameras... and if given the order, she could even turn a TV into a bomb to take him out.

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: (what we're all

dialogues.speaker: THINKING
dialogues.text: But what if --

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: -- she can't act without authorization. See, she's bound not to countermand our laws -- even the Declaration of Independence is woven into her source code. Her primary role's pre-emptive -- running simulations, identifying threats before they become real...

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Wait, you think we're a.threat?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No. You're a means to an end. On TV, CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENTS -- ZOOM to words in CLOS

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Under National Security Directive 359, Sub-Section 72 -- "when units are needed for the national defense, civilians shall be ordered to active Federal service..."

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: you're drafting us?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The guy you killed in the desert -- last time I checked, murder wasn't legal.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: In fact, it is. Chapter 802 of the Uniform Code of Military Justice states desertion is punishable by death. So matter-of-fact, its chilling. And what Jerry wants to more than anything, is...

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: what'd my brother have to do with this? A picture of PAUL SHAW'S DEFENSE I.D. pops on screen:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (trying to process) No, he worked for the State Department..:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Everyone in deep operations has a cover. Your brother was a Horseman.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: What's the hell is a 'Horseman'?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You know, clever allegory -- of the apocalypse'--`except we're here to prevent it. Scott taps the console, ID PHOTOS APPEAR of our four "Hor PAUL SHAW, SCOTT, and two men we'll call LOWELL and JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Officially, we don't exist, but we monitor Aria's network 24/7. There were :four of us... til Paul died. (beat, it's still raw) He was smarter than all of us put together.

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: Working here must be pretty tough -- all the security, the pressure, long hours... As in: "Did you notice him acting strangely?"

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you could set your watch by Paul. Except...

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: Except what?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: The night he died? He left his shift three minutes early. Which you don't do. Which he wouldn't do. Latesha's suddenly locked in on a clue -- PRELAP:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Paul and I had a disagreement before he expired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry sinks to the edge of the bed, runs hands: through h

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: To amend it, I need Jerry to perform a task. Simple.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Expired?! You mean died.. That's what we call it, we humans, we call it dying--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What's the task?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: To insure the national security of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What d'you need me for then?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That is not your concern right now.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Alright, this is bullshit. I'm not doing this --- and you're a computer, you don't know a goddamn thing about my brother.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I know all about him, Jerry. And you. The screen snaps to a SLIDE SHOW of PAUL SHAW'S accomplis childhood birthday parties, sports teams, surrounded by f beautiful girlfriends, high school graduation, Yale gradu standing with their dad, William's arm over his shoulder. almost GASPS at Aria's reaching into his subconscious:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Your brother succeeded in everything he did. (MNRF)

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Before he was a year old, he walked. Something that took you eighteen months to accomplish. He was highly gifted, intelligent and principled -- in fact, the only Horseman ever to challenge me. But you, Jerry -- The slide show CHANGES to SECURITY FOOTAGE of Jerry at KI slaving away. Playing cards with Kwame, slacking off. His stomach drops. Seeing himself like this. Looking so pathe The heart has just been cut out of him. Rachel sees it --

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You are similar to Paul in DNA only. Historically you have succeeded in nothing. Initiated nothing. Excelled in nothing. You will perform the task because it is your nature to follow. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because you've seen what happens to deserters.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: -- Jesus, ENOUGH! The screen goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You have 23 minutes to prepare. There's an adjoining suite with a second bathroom. The DOOR to the adjoining SUITE clicks open.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Use it. And she's gone, replaced by the hotel's promotional pratt

dialogues.speaker: TV VOICE
dialogues.text: The Four Seasons prides itself on excellent service Jerry stares, overcome. Rachel watches him an emotional b

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? Without answering, he grabs the bag. Walks into the other without a word. Closes the door. She stares, feeling his shame... then her eyes go to the BRIEFCASE TIMER counting

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Halloway-Smith contracted us to transport the briefcase to their corporate office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank's roped off and labelled "CRIME AREA." Morgan questions the Couriers, studies their transport manifest:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Biotech? The chemical company?

dialogues.speaker: BRINKS COURIER
dialogues.text: When they make a new compound, they, hold it in a vault for clinical trials.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (scans the manifest) Why'd the HAZMAT office issue a special permit for the case?

dialogues.speaker: BRINKS COURIER
dialogues.text: You'd have to ask -- could be` anything from a boner pill to a bioweapon, they never tell us.

dialogues.speaker: BRINKS COURIER
dialogues.text: Tell you one thing, though... the guy never handled a gun before. That LANDS with Morgan. He nods to an agent, dismissing the couriers. Grant approaches:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRANT
dialogues.text: We pulled video... nothing. No good angles on Shaw or the girl.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: There.are 14 visible cameras in the lobby! " 8 hidden no one can see!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRANT
dialogues.text: Gotta be a hacker, someone keeping them ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's a Federal bank; encryption doesn't get more secure.., from now on assume our air's been compromised, too. Tell everyone to go secure on Tac-3, nobody communicates outside this task force without my say-so.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRANT
dialogues.text: I'm on it -- also: they found this upstairs, but the trace signal's dead -- Holds up an evidence bag with Jerry's BONE MIC inside.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Do not tell me that is what I think it is. (snatches it, pissed) Goddamnit, who's leading these people around?! Someone's behind the Wizard of Oz! He turns and spots something: A SURVEILLANCE CAMERA in th window of a 7-11. Starts MOVING toward it.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's face WHIPS UP INTO FRAME, her hair now DYED BLON She stares at her reflection, trying to:process it all. . her cell RINGS: "KYLE." With a GASP she picks it up--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: -- Kyle?!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Hey, mom, it's. me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: -- sweetie, where areou, are you -- But she's INTERRUPTED as she realizes, oddly, it's a VOIC her heart SINKS:

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Got your message, the train's awesome -- Brian tried to burp the alphabet but gagged when he got to "M." I'll call when we hit D.C. Bye, ma -- Rachel holding the phone like it's some kind of life-line son. When there's a strange BEEP then the voice of ARIA:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Your son left that message sixty seconds ago.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever you want -- don't hurt him, please -- I'm begging you. Listen - you're trying to protect something too, right? You'll do whatever it takes. Well that's what it's like to be a mother -- can you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: There were over 52,000 vocal tone options for my program; I chose this one precisely because it sounds so maternal. People tend to do what you ask when you sound like their mother.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (eyes close, so lost) Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You'll see your son again soon. Bute there's something I require from you first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry approaches the door, hair now BROWN. Beat. He knock

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Rachel? We gotta go INTERCUT: Rachel in the bathroom, her face betraying the of what she's just heard, what Aria's just told her to do

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What? No way, I can't just --

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: -- when the time comes I'll instruct you to stepaway:fromJerry. Once you hear those words, you'll have thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rachel? You in there?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Answer Jerry, please. INTERCUT:;Jerry still standing outside the door. Rachel's VOICE,"mustering strength through the door:

dialogues.speaker: COMING
dialogues.text: Steeling herself, she steps out. Forces a smile while ave her eyes. And pushes past h2-,n like he's lagging...

dialogues.text: Latesha PACES THROUGH FRAME, nervously filing her nails w MINI SWISS ARMY KNIFE as she talks into a headset. A DESK watches, annoyed by the filing:

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: I dunno, the whole thing's off somehow - but get this: B-36 isn't a security classification, it's a sub-level here at the Pentagon -- (sees the DESK GUARD eyeing her) What? Girl's gotta groom.

dialogues.text: Morgan's on the other end, Grant and the Clerk run throug playback of the CCTV FEEDS looking out onto the street in of 7-11. Good old-fashioned VCR.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (into cell) -- you're shitting me

dialogues.text: Yeah, 36 floors underground -- and it gets weirder:

dialogues.speaker: INTERCEPTING CALL."
dialogues.text: INTERCUTTING WITH MORGAN IN THE 7-11 -- he hears:

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Four years ago, DARPA commissioned... (garbled)... .computer... (garbled)...

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Simms? You're breaking up -- WITH LATESHA -- her cell LCD says: "Call lost." No bars. Muttering "dainnit," she tries to call Morgan back. No di ARIA PQV CAM: Latesha snaps her phone shut, notices the c watching her. Unsettling. We read: "VOICE MIMEO ACTIVATED

dialogues.text: And though Latesha isn't speaking, WE START TO HEAR HER V

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA/ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Sorry about that -- As we realize Aria's taken over the call by mimicking Lat

dialogues.text: I heard 'DARPA' and 'computer' --?

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA/ARIA
dialogues.text: Yes, B-36 was part of a super-computer project, but it was decommissioned. A dead end. The archives are at Fort Meade. Do you want me to head over there? -- but Morgan's only half-listening now as he sees. somet the CCTV feeds:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Wait -- go back, freeze that - WHAT HE SEES: A STILL of Jerry and Rachel getting in the faces obscured.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Punch up the plate The image enhances, revealing a PLATE NUMBER, its frame b the company name: "ICON LIMOUSINE SERVICES."

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Grant) Find that car! (back to Latesha) Simms, gotta jump, sit tight 'til I call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latesha returns to the NETWORK MONITORING HUB to find Sco typing at.the console. A MACHINE ARM drops down from abov spider-like.: The device animates as a CRANIAL SCANNER op

dialogues.text: Aria's system uses biometric security to identify us, so only Horsemen can access her core programming. Suddenly his head's ensconced in a LASER GRID that scans inch of his features: "PROCESSING FOR MATCH... HORSEMAN I CONFIRMED: BOWMAN, SCOTT." Latesha watches somewhat dumbs as the machine arm retreats upward.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (clicks on mic) Aria, go voice active, please.

dialogues.text: It talks?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA OVER SPEAKER, (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Aria, this is Latesha Simms, she's here as part of a counter-terrorism task force. ARIA OVER SPEAKER.(V.0. A pleasure to serve you, Ms. Simms.

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: (thrown, to Scott). Am I supposed to -- (he gestures, "answer Um... what's up. SCOTT. Aria, I'd like to:bring,up all the log feeds the night Paul died -- when he left the building.

dialogues.text: Of course. Scott types on the console and after a BEAT grainy black- white SURVEILLANCE FEED springs up onto the big MONITOR. Several different angles Of PAUL SHAW exiting the mainfra tank, moving down corridors, getting in the elevator. Wei see this TINTYPE of Jerry. Same eyes, same hair, same wal Flicks a quick look up at the camera --

dialogues.text: There's no feed from inside here?

dialogues.text: No need for cameras in here, we've got Aria. Latesha looks through a glass divider at Aria floating in tank. Creeped out. The FOOTAGE JUMPING as Paul rounds the corner for the elevator. Presses his THUMB to the panel.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So weird... no overt body language, he's even casual. Leaving like it's any other day.

dialogues.text: Except three minutes early... ON THE MONITOR: the elevator doors open and Paul steps in Latesha studies the feed. Something's not right. Then... her eyes NARROW: the way Paul's facing the button Like he's deliberately pivoting away from the camera.

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, in the reflection, did you see that? Scott rewinds the FOOTAGE, ZOOMS IN. Paul stepping into t elevator and facing the button panel. CLOSE ON HIS FACE in the panel's REFLECTIVE SURFACE --

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Is he... blinking? Yes. Erratically, deliberately. Fucking weird. Scott and Latesha share a look. Suddenly, the image on the monitor to FLICKER and JUMP --

dialogues.speaker: ARIA. OVER SPEAKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm experiencing interference in network 7752B, please allow me to shut down and analyze.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Negative, I'm prioritizing this.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA OVER SPEAKER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'll note my protest in the data log. This is getting weirder by the second -- PAUL'S DISTORTED REFLECTION in the panel, his eyes definitely blinking wei

dialogues.text: It's like he's trying to say something...

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: A code. He's blinking code

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: It's not Morse, but there's a sequence to it --

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: (then, a GRIN) Oh, that sonofabitch... He grabs a piece of paper and starts WRITING MADLY, scrib numbers, scratching some out, then converting them to LET F... I.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (as he works) It's a code -- Hexadecimal -- a number system that can be converted to letters the first computer used it as a programming language back in the 50's. Latesha watches, rapt: R... E. E... X... T. ." ON THE FEED: the elevator door OPENS and Paul steps out. all they get. They stare, trying to make sense of the let

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: The hell is that? Staring, minds spinning -- and suddenly.she puts.a FINGER between the two "E's." Dividing words.. And GETS IT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING FAST together down the same corridor Paul went dow They turn a corner... and STOP DEAD:- A FIRE EXTINGUISHER is mounted on the wall. Latesha sees the placement of the CAMERAS caddy-corner to intersecting hallways... and knows what Paul was doing:

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: It's the only spot in the hallway not covered by .the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was hiding something from her. A SHIFT to ARIA CAM confirms it: she can't see exactly wh they're doin Latesha moves urgently to the extinguisher, starts examin for something, anything... but finds NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't get it. He had to be saying 'Fire Extinguisher.' Scott pulls a MAINTENANCE SHEET off the wall. Scans --

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Maintenance replaced it yesterday. (scanning the sheet) This isn't right... they weren't supposed to do it til June. They lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LATESHA
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She read the code too... where's 'Recyling'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo glides through traffic. In back, Rachel's nodded Jerry watches her from across the limo, sketching somethi cocktail napkin... RACHEL'S FACE. It's a perfect, beautif rendering. And we sense something in his look too-- something's changed. As Rachel wakes with a start --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hey -- sorry, I didn't mean to -- am I drooling? I bet I'm drooling. You didn't sleep?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Night shifts. I'm used to. Rachel sits up, sees the napkin. Grins, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Wow, is that me?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: One of my only party tricks.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (truly impressed) It's really good. Jerry looks down at it, not used to having his work appre Rachel, can see how deeply affected he was by what Aria s It seems to make her feel uuiilty somehow... kinder...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: About what Aria said... I'm sorry. They're;starting to connect. He glances out the window...

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You have to understand, I wasn't his twin, I was more like his... little brother. Always trying to catch up. And you wouldn't believe how... nice he was to me. Teaching me things when we were kids, telling me how great I was. He was the only one who ever did. (almost smiles) Of course he was involved in some super secret National Security project. He was a superstar. He had a rocket strapped to his back. I'm the fuck-up. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wear it like a medal, like it actually means something... but the funny thing is? This is probably the most important thing I'll ever do. This. Right now. This completely insane journey or whatever it is. I'm actually needed in something, me. Jerry Shaw is required. But what am I thinking? I'll probably fuck this up, too --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're being too hard on yourself--

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: No. I'm not being hard enough. That's been the problem. They look at each other. A real moment for Jerry. A seism shift in his life perspective. But then something catches eye -- his look DARKENS. Out the window, a highway sign: "DAYTON INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT." The driver's.tinted divid window lowers, he offers a folder.

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: Your passports and itinerary. Now Rachel's seen the airport. sign, too. Looks at Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (to driver) Uh... could you give us a minute? The Chauffeur nods, the window RISES again. Heart poundin Jerry grabs the briefcase and slides back the timer sheat check the countdown: "00:15:36...00:15:35..."

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don't think --

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: -- we know what she can do, she doesn't need us to crash a plane --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: -- what if it's not about just one plane? They look at each other. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck. What to do. Wh Rachel grabs the briefcase as the limo pulls curbside.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have more to lose in this. If anything happens to Kyle then my life's over anyway -- But Jerry grabs her hand, taking the case.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Rachel -- til we met, I had nothing to lose. We do this together. A LONG LOOK BETWEEN THEM. As they realize, this could be

Jerry and Rachel enter, adrenaline pumping -- he opens the envelope to reveal two PASSPORTS their photos, but the names "MARK and ALLISON ACKERMAN." THEN Aria's VOICE comes over the P.A.: ARIA OVER P.A. Allison Ackerman, please pick up the white courtesy phone -- They stop, hearing her. Rachel TENSES in this moment move to the RINGING courtesy phone, answers:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Go to the ticketing machine, you'll receive two tickets to Paris.

dialogues.text: -- Paris?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (V.0.)

dialogues.text: A chopper TOUCHES DOWN near a waiting contingent of AGENT AIRPORT PD -- Morgan and Grant hop out on the MOVE, handi BLURRY VIDEO STILLS from the 7-11:

Jerry nervously sets it on the conveyor belt, they pull o their shoes... watch the case move toward the mouth of th machine, then pass through the metal detector, catching a GLIMPSE of the X-RAY SCREEN... the briefcase glides into A STRANGE GLITCH as the screen fritzes, then normalizes revealing the contents: A HAIR DRYER AND DIRTY CLOTHES?! notice the surveillance cam watching:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (a murmur) she changed the screen... The case comes off the conveyor, the TSA agent hands it b

dialogues.text: Can't be too careful.

dialogues.text: (forces a smile) You're doing a great job. As they walk on, he checks the timer, 00:03:22... 00:03:2 They pass a KIDS' BAND and their teacher, gathered around airline CUSTOMER SERVICE DESK.

dialogues.text: (EXASPERATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're supposed.to be in DC by --

dialogues.text: I'm sorry, si.r,..there's nothing I can do-- INTERCUT SURVEILLANCE CAMERA POV: Aria tracks Morgan as h reaches the upper concourse just as... Jerry turns and...

dialogues.text: (into walkie) I have him on the upper concourse, C terminal!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (to Rachel, urgent) -- we aottago As Morgan races forward, ARIA ACTS: the X-ray screen FRIT again as another carry-on goes through, revealing its "co as a HAND GUN AND KNIVES! The TSA agent hits a RED BUTTON

dialogues.text: MOVING WITH JERRY AND RACHEL -- past a wall made of THIRT SCREEN MONITORS that form one massive NIKE ad of Lebron s dunking -- at once, the screens CHANGE to spell out the w GATE 17-C. THEY'RE THIRTEEN SECONDS BEHIND YOU. Jerry and Rachel streak towards 17-C as the screens RETUR NORMAL when Morgan and agents follow with pistols swingin INTERCUT SURVEILLANCE CAM POV: as Jerry and Rachel hurtle an ATM MACHINE, IT SPITS OUT A CASH CLOUD..THAT"INCITES A FRENZY -- agents SLAM into commuters and topple --
